intro: Heisteria stipulacea, commonly known as the silverleaf heister, is a perennial flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Simaroubaceae and is characterized by its silvery, fuzzy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. Heisteria stipulacea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique leaf texture and attractive flowers. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers.
